SQL Server Instance {#INST} DB {#DBNAME}: Active Transactions
item_prototype.description: Number of active transactions for the database.

item_prototype.name: SQL Server Instance {#INST} DB {#DBNAME}: Data File Size
item_prototype.description: Cumulative size (in kilobytes) of all the data files in the database including any automatic growth. Monitoring this counter is useful, for example, for determining the correct size of tempdb.

item_prototype.name: SQL Server Instance {#INST} DB {#DBNAME}: Log Bytes Flushed/sec
item_prototype.description: Total number of log bytes flushed per second. Useful for determining trends and utilization of the transaction log.

item_prototype.name: SQL Server Instance {#INST} DB {#DBNAME}: Log File Size
item_prototype.description: Cumulative size (in kilobytes) of all the transaction log files in the database.

item_prototype.name: SQL Server Instance {#INST} DB {#DBNAME}: Log File Used Size
item_prototype.description: The cumulative used size of all the log files in the database.

item_prototype.name: SQL Server Instance {#INST} DB {#DBNAME}: Log Flushes/sec
item_prototype.description: Number of log flushes per second.

item_prototype.name: SQL Server Instance {#INST} DB {#DBNAME}: Log Flush Waits/sec
item_prototype.description: Number of commits per second waiting for the log flush.

item_prototype.name: SQL Server Instance {#INST} DB {#DBNAME}: Log Flush Wait Time
item_prototype.description: Total wait time (in milliseconds) to flush the log. On an AlwaysOn secondary database, this value indicates the wait time for log records to be hardened to disk.

item_prototype.name: SQL Server Instance {#INST} DB {#DBNAME}: Log Growths
item_prototype.description: Total number of times the transaction log for the database has been expanded.

item_prototype.name: SQL Server Instance {#INST} DB {#DBNAME}: Log Shrinks
item_prototype.description: Total number of times the transaction log for the database has been shrunk.

item_prototype.name: SQL Server Instance {#INST} DB {#DBNAME}: Log Truncations
item_prototype.description: The number of times the transaction log has been shrunk.

item_prototype.name: SQL Server Instance {#INST} DB {#DBNAME}: Percent Log Used
item_prototype.description: Percentage of space in the log that is in use.

item_prototype.name: SQL Server Instance {#INST} DB {#DBNAME}: Transactions per second

SQL Server Instance {#INST}:General Statistics\Processes Blocked

item_prototype.name: SQL Server Instance {#INST} DB {#DBNAME}: Database Status

trigger_prototype.name: Database - {#DBNAME} on Instance {#INST} is not running
trigger_prototype.description: EC tag is for Event Correlation. Setup a rule for "event tag pair", use EC=EC, and set operation to close new event. This way only one event per database remains open.

trigger_prototype.name: Database - {#DBNAME} on Instance {#INST} Users Cannot Connect
trigger_prototype.description: EC tag is for Event Correlation. Setup a rule for "event tag pair", use EC=EC, and set operation to close new event. This way only one event per database remains open.
